page.title: 03BOUNDARY DIVISIONS
page.content: Spitler's Edge marks the County Constituency Parliamentary Boundary between the Darwen and Rossendale Constituency and the Chorley Constituency. The Civil Parishes covering this area (apart from the Darwen Moor area in the north-east corner) are North Turton, Tockholes, Withnell and Wheelton which have parish councils and Anglezarke which has an annual parish meeting. The Civil Parish of North Turton comprises the villages of Edgworth, Chapeltown, Entwistle and Belmont and the surrounding countrysides. North Turton Parish includes a small portion of the ancient Sharples township. Anglezarke Parish consists of only approximately 30 dwellings.
